documentation_insights.application_purpose: This application is a reworked version of the Docker Official Samples' voting application, designed for easy deployment on OpenShift. It allows users to vote on different options and view the results.
security_considerations: Ability to run containers as non-root users (using `nonroot` SCC for uid=1001).
Security of the source code and Dockerfiles is maintained through Git repositories.
Source to Image (S2I) can deploy already secured container images in the cluster.
documentation_insights.deployment_model: OpenShift (including local deployments with CodeReady Containers, OKD, or Minishift)

annotations.description:
PostgreSQL database service, without persistent storage. For more information about using this template, including OpenShift considerations, see https://github.com/sclorg/postgresql-container/.

WARNING: Any data stored will be lost upon pod destruction. Only use this template for testing
annotations.openshift.io/long-description: This template provides a standalone PostgreSQL server with a database created.  The database is not stored on persistent storage, so any restart of the service will result in all data being lost.  The database name, username, and password are chosen via parameters when provisioning this service.

annotations.description:
Redis in-memory data structure store, without persistent storage. For more information about using this template, including OpenShift considerations, see https://github.com/sclorg/redis-container/blob/master/5.

WARNING: Any data stored will be lost upon pod destruction. Only use this template for testing
annotations.openshift.io/long-description: This template provides a standalone Redis server.  The data is not stored on persistent storage, so any restart of the service will result in all data being lost.

database_interactions.raw_query: SELECT vote, COUNT(id) AS count FROM votes GROUP BY vote
UPDATE votes SET vote = ? WHERE id = ?
CREATE TABLE IF NOT EXISTS votes (id VARCHAR(255) NOT NULL UNIQUE, vote VARCHAR(255) NOT NULL)

recommendations: 🚀 Implement automated CI/CD pipeline for consistent deployments
✅ Add more quality gates (code coverage, static analysis, security scanning)
🐳 Consider containerizing all components for consistent deployment
